dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: We won't let that happen, sir.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You won't, huh?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (to a technician) When can we get these things operational?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: They're a hive mind, sir.  It takes three for their predictive abilities to be fully operational.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: These two are all I have to find the man who is about to murder me.  Hook them up, and flood them with whatever kind of fucking chemicals you have to.  They are a machine, and I need that machine at my disposal.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Ennis Page is a man unglued.  He sits on a tidy little sofa, in a tidy 1950's style living room.  But his movements have become untidy.  He puts a very tiny pill on his tongue. When he drinks from a glass of water, it dribbles down his chin onto his shirt.  Not like Ennis, at all. When his doorbell RINGS, he slowly looks up, then looks down at the floor again.  He doesn't answer it.  It RINGS some more. And then Lisa is standing there before him
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She sits down beside him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She glances at the bubble pack of pills on the table beside him, three gone.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Unexpectedly, tears well up in Ennis's eyes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Lisa holds the Precog disc in front of his eyes.  He closes them against the sight, as if it were an evil talisman. -----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ennis's eyes open again.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ennis tries to think through his fear and haze.  His words slur.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The pills, his tidy world coming apart -- Ennis is losing it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ennis just wants her to go away.  He wants it all to go away. Tears stream down his face.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ennis is sliding away.  Lisa takes hold of him.  Makes him listen, dammit.  She points to the disc in her hand.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Lisa shakes him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ennis gives her a look that's on the other side of comprehension.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ennis's eyes roll back into his head.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Your IdentiScan is off, Ennis.  I could just walk in here.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I forgot.  To turn it on.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You don't look surprised to see me.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I need your help.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: He took one of my babies.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: He's desperate, Ennis.  He had to. (beat) We have to help him.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It's a fake Ennis.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: This is the first disc.  You delivered it to Director Anderson.  He reviewed it.  And then he stole it, and went on the run.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I delivered ... a fake .. to him?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: But he thought it was real, and ran with it.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: An hour later, you delivered a second disc of the same event.  Witwer reviewed it.  It was real.  (Beat) How do I know this?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Director Anderson had his eyes changed.  They were blue. Now he has brown ones.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: This disc, the fake one, shows a blueeyed Anderson murdering Witwer two days from now.  He doesn't have blue eyes anymore.  The person who faked this disc had no idea he would change his eyes.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Listen!  But the second disc has to be real, because he has brown eyes when he murders Witwer. (MORE) -----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (beat) Somebody tried to frame him with a fake.  And somehow it all became real . Why, Ennis?  How could this happen?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You handle the discs.  How did a fake one get delivered?
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Coffee ...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But Ennis sags unconscious.  She shakes him hard, even slaps him, but Ennis is out.  She lets him drop down on the sofa. From outside the house, somewhere high in the clouds, comes the WHINE of a hovercraft. Lisa looks once more at Ennis, then gets out of there
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: You want-- ?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: He spilled coffee everywhere ... Everywhere ...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What coffee?  What are you -- ?
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: A small, dreary room, invisible with insignificance.  Which is just the kind of room you want if you've stolen a Precog. The female Precog lies on a cot.  Anderson sits on a metal folding chair watching her. Her eyes slowly open and look at him
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She turns away and looks at the yellowing paper on the wall. There is a fading pink cabbage rose.  She traces the outline of it with her thin finger. She turns back to him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It is deeply eerie for him, chatting with a Precog.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Her eyes grow very serious.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Anderson rises, moves around the small room.  He is shamed, embarrassed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She turns to the wall.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It is heartrendingly touching, the smile she gives him when she faces him again.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: For a long moment he can't say anything.  But there are things he needs to understand ...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Anderson can't meet her eyes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Her words are unbearable, for both of them.  She traces the outline of the wallpaper rose again.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Anderson looks at her, then goes to the window, carefully watches the street below.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She lies on the bed, watching as Anderson comes back to her. He sits carefully on the side of her bed. -----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Then be reaches out, and gently touches her cheek
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She is almost too overwhelmed to speak
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And now it is Anderson who is overwhelmed
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: My brothers aren't here.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You didn't even look around.  You knew.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (beat) We can sense each other.  You must save
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Stop.  I saved You. It was the best I could do.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Thank you, Anderson.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What am I going to do with you?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Name me, Anderson.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Give me a name.  I've never had one.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Listen.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Listen to me. (beat) Listen to me ... Rose.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Rose.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Rose.  They shifted your precognition so you would locate me.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (guiltily) I didn't know.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: When they shifted you to find me, you didn't reveal everything.  That I was going to break into Precrime.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: We saw our chance.  You would need to shut us down, you would have to come.  We wanted you to come.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You used me -- to save you.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I have been used all my life, Anderson.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No one cared that we were human. From a human mother.  Taken at birth. Hooked to machines. (beat) We have been alive, Anderson. Enslaved, for the greater good.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: But now I have a name.  And I know the man who has named - me will not allow me to be enslaved again.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Rose.  What's going to happen to us? Can you see that?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'm weak.  And away from my brothers. I see glimpses and hints of things nearby.  But it's all ... scattered. (beat) I'm tired of the future, Anderson.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You didn't know I was going to do that, did you?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No.  Oh, Anderson.  It was lovely.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . ENNIS PAGE'S HOUSE  DAWN If he were not already dead, it would've killed Ennis Page to see the state of his living room.  Precrime officers everywhere.  Blood on the rug.  A gun beside the sofa. Witwer stands in the corner of the room witching the Coroner crab walk Page's body.  It WHIRS and CLICKS as it probes and takes samples from various sites. The holographic doctor waits patiently as the Coroner crab makes its determinations. Lieutenant Glaser talks quietly to Witwer
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The crab probes the ragged hole in Page's head
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Lieutenant rolls his eyes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Witwer doesn't say anything.  He just stares at the body The crab finishes.  The holographic doctor unfolds his arms and turns his head to Witwer.  He is only a computer interface, but even so, it seems as if there is surprise in his digitalized voice.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No one says anything as the holographic doctor dematerializes and the Coroner crab walks across the floor and puts itself back in its box. At last, someone moves.  It is Witwer.  He lifts his arm, pulls back his shirtsleeve, and stares long and hard at his watch.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Who else could it've been?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: He grabbed a Precog so he could commit an undetected murder.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (beat) Page worshipped the system.  He fell apart.  Shot himself.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Anderson.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (beat) A mortal wound was generated by a .38 calibre bullet delivered to the left occipital portion of the anterior skull, on June 16th, 2040, at 1:24 am, Eastern Standard Time.  A Phase Two Investigation is in order.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . WITWER'S OFFICE -- DAY LATER Lisa sits biting her lip as Witwer watches two monitors play the two versions of Anderson's murder of Witwer.  Lisa points.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She reaches down and freezes on a close-up of Anderson on the two monitors.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: There.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: ON - THE MONITORS On the left monitor Anderson has blue eyes, on the right he has brown.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Witwer stares for a long time.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And now Lisa smiles.  She has set her lawyerly mind to the solution.  It is her moment .
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The simplicity of it is inconceivable.  Witwer speaks carefully, trying to process it
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Witwer stares at the proof before him.  -- the different colored eyes of Anderson.  He ejects both discs and holds them in his hands.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Witwer looks at the two discs he is holding
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The blood drains from Lisa's face
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Witwer's hands close tight on the discs.  Lisa stands there, motionless.  Then she turns, and leaves his office, abruptly. He watches her go.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: The one on the left, the first disc -it's a fake. He doesn't have blue eyes anymore.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: A fake. (BEAT) But the Precogs predict the infallible truth.  They don't emit fake discs.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (beat) But that doesn't mean someone couldn't have made a fake disc on their own and inserted it into the delivery system.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Bypass the Precogs and slip a fake disc in with that day's real ones...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (excited) We're all programmed to believe anything we see on a Precog disc. The system has never been wrong ...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You have to call off the hunt.  He was set up.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (long beat) It's gone too far, Lisa She shakes her head, shocked at his response
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: He was set up!  You both were.  If Paul kills you, you're both out of the picture.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Who wants us out?  Of what picture?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Jesus, Ed. Stop this thing!  And then we can investigate Witwer's mouth opens and closes.  He tries again.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Ennis Page was murdered last night.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: He's not a murderer.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I think he is.  A murderer ... and a future murderer. (beat) Lisa.  What does it matter that the first disc is a fake ... if the second one's real?
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Rose sits in a chair near the window.  She is chewing lightly on a cracker.  Her face shows wonder -- at the cracker's texture and taste.  She holds it up and admires its shape. Anderson's mood is less wondrous
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Rose.  Listen to me.  I'm going to leave you here.  I have to keep moving.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: No.  You must save my brothers.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Rose waits for him to finish.  She looks out the window at the street scene.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He does, reluctantly.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: It's impossible.  There's no time. I've done what I can do!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Come here, Anderson.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Do you see that boy in the blue hat walking with his mother? (beat) In sixty seconds he will walk beneath those workers installing a window on the tenth floor of that building.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Two men struggle to lift a large window in place.  Way below the little boy in the blue hat walks on along the sidewalk holding his mother's hand. -----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Anderson turns to her, shocked And then he runs for the door, hurls it open, and disappears down the hall. Rose listens to his FOOTSTEPS crashing down the stairs
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: They'll drop the window, killing him.  It is impossible to save him.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . Even as Anderson rushes out of the boarding house, the WORKERS have lost their grip on the window. The little BOY in the blue hat and his MOTHER walk unwittingly toward disaster.  They do not appear to hear the MEN'S cries. The WINDOW falls end over end above the boy's head.  The sunlight sparks off of the glass, so that from a distance it looks like a star falling from the sky.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: across the street sees what is happening, and cries out. But what Anderson does is run. He runs faster and harder than humanly possible.  He does not care if he is recognized or hit by a passing taxi.  He is going to get to that boy. He has to get to that boy ...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: rams the BOY from behind just as the corner of the window frame kisses the boy's blue hat.  He knocks the boy to safety as glass and metal SMASH into the sidewalk. The mother does not even have time to scream.  She is on the ground, stunned, But Anderson has saved the boy. He rolls away, and gets to his feet.  Before anyone can put together what has happened, Anderson has ducked into an alley, and is gone.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Anderson enters the room again, out of breath, some small cuts on his face and hands.  He stands across the room staring at Rose. Rose considers him.  When she speaks her voice is near and distant at the same time.  For Anderson, it is as if the words are coming from a place inside his own head.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Rose reveals nothing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Anderson almost laughs.  Her persistence is unbelievable
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Rose suddenly grimaces in pain, and grips the side of her head.  She curls into a fetal position. Anderson goes to her, touches her thin shoulder.  Her eyes roll into the back of her head. Whose pain is she feeling?  Her own?  Someone else's? Anderson doesn't want to think about it.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: It was impossible to save that boy
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: but you did, Anderson.  It's in you.  It's what you are .
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You knew it wasn't impossible.  That I'd get there.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You are a man who saves others. (beat) Save my brothers.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'm in a lot of trouble right now.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: My brothers are in more trouble. They've moved them to ... an awful place.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Rose.  Ed Witwer -he's in the most trouble of all.  Who saves him ?
dialogue.name: dialogue

result.ToD: PRECOG ENGINEERING LAB -CHEVY CHASE, MD -- NIGHT
result.heading: PRECOG ENGINEERING LAB -CHEVY CHASE, MD -- NIGHT

direction.raw_text: . PRECOG ENGINEERING LAB -CHEVY CHASE, MD -- NIGHT Because Anderson has destroyed the Precog Chamber, the two Precog brothers have been brought here. The room is makeshift, uncomfortable ... a place for experiments.  The brothers are strapped into chairs.  They are helmeted. But unlike before, large bore needles have been placed in their jugular veins.  Connected to the needles are long twists of IV tubing.  There are several IVs running at high drip rates. Witwer has his back to all this.  He stands with Dr. Resfield, watching a technician working the keyboard on a huge mainframe. Dr. Resfield, a man not given to squeamishness looks back at the Precogs, uneasy. -----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He stops talking when he looks into Witwer's hollow eyes. Witwer is somewhere beyond the influence and reach of words.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: . RESFIELD We're not really set up for this type of
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . BOARDING HOUSE ROOM -- MORNING Anderson tries to get Rose to drink some water.  Her skin is translucent, unhealthy, glistening with sweat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She pushes the cup away.  She closes her eyes, as if even the dim light of the room causes her pain.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She opens her eyes.  Anderson doesn't like the feel of this.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She covers his mouth with her hand
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: For a long time, Rose says nothing, Her gaze is locked onto a distance beyond the room.  At last, she speaks.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Rose.  Try to drink.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Your wife.  We have to get her here, Anderson.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Why?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I don't know ...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What are you seeing?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Glimpses, Anderson.  Please.  We have to get her here.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You're scaring me, Rose
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Stop talking.  It uses me up.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: In three minutes your wife will take a walk ..
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . She gets up and hurriedly leaves her office
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . JUDICIAL CENTER -- MOMENTS LATER Witwer walks past Lisa's SECRETARY toward the open door of Lisa's office.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Witwer stares into the empty office.  There is a clock on Lisa's desk.  His eyes fix on it.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Sir?  I'm sorry, she stepped out for a few minutes. (beat) Sir?
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Lisa moves quickly down the steps of the white marble building.  She takes a deep breath, then heads down Jefferson Boulevard toward the city. A sleek black TRANSPORT with two Precrime officers in it follows her from a discreet distance. In the sky above, the ubiquitous Precrime hovercraft
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Lisa walks down the street.  She hugs herself, barely aware of her surroundings.  She passes by stores, restaurants, payphones, video kiosks ... oblivious.  People push past her. On a street corner, as she waits at a red light, the payphone beside her begins to RING.  If she hears it, she gives no indication.  A KID reaches for it, listens, hangs up. She walks on.  Stores.  Restaurants.  An art gallery.  As she comes abreast of another PAYPHONE, it suddenly starts to ring.  This time Lisa glances at it.  But again, walks on. The TRANSPORT weaves through traffic, nearby She walks past the K.L. Lawrence Graphics Museum.  And another restaurant. And a PAYPHONE.  And this time, finally, when it, too, RINGS, she turns and looks hard at it. A man begins to walk over to it.  Lisa almost knocks him out of the way to get to it.  She grabs at the receiver.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Lisa pushes the buttons on her digital watch as she listens
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Hello?  Hello?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I need you.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It's 1:03.  Set your watch, exactly.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Okay.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We now hear ANDERSON continue in VOICE OVER as we follow Lisa through a SEQUENCE OF EVENTS ...
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: This is what you have to do ...
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Lisa walks up the steps of the museum
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) At 1:07 hang up the phone and enter the Lawrence Museum.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Lisa walks quickly through a display of 19th century magazine advertising.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The two Precrime officers walk into a room filled with Chinese graphics.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The officers start toward the entrance way to another room, then hesitate uncertainly, and go for another entrance way.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) At 1:13 the two Precrime officers following you take a wrong turn into a different room, losing sight of you for ten seconds.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Lisa hurries down the steps
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Lisa boards the "A" MagLev train
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) An undercover transport officer will have received emergency orders to follow you. (MORE) He's wearing a red tie.  He has short blond hair. -----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: The blond transport officer with the red tie sits at the far end of Lisa's car, watching her. At the next stop Lisa gets off.  He follows, not too far behind.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Lisa starts up the stairs.  She looks at her watch, then makes herself pause a few moments, to keep within Anderson's time frame.  She starts up again.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Lisa does this, and the officer reels back, surprised. At the same moment two big men rushing to catch a subway come into view, and see this happening.  Lisa starts to run.  When the undercover officer tries to stop her, the two men grab the officer, and they get into a fight. Lisa escapes.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) As you come around the bend, cry out and turn around and slap the officer...
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Lisa looks at her watch, then taps the window for the driver to stop.  She gets out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She hails another taxi.  She holds her hand over the IdentiScan before it can read her.  The taxi driver looks at her, sees her smile, sees the prepaid cash card she holds out to him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's The Sprawl -- stranger things have happened.  He grabs the card, and jerks his head for her to get in.  They take off. -----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) Stay on Ninth street.  Underneath Ninth street is the main power feed for The Sprawl.  It'll mess up the navigational beacon on the hovercraft. (beat) Keep switching taxis.  But stay on Ninth.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Two hundred dollars if you don't scan me.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . NINTH STREET  LATER Lisa gets out of the taxi and looks briefly into the sky. It is dense with holographic billboards, skim-jets, dirigibles.  Somewhere in all that is a Precrime hovercraft. And the neighborhood around her is definitely downscale.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) The hovercraft will try to drop altitude, but the air traffic will slow it down. (beat) Precrime loses you.  You'll have to walk two miles.  Don't get scanned.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Lisa walks hurriedly down a side street.  She stands out in her white dress -- a spot of vulnerable color in world of black. Too vulnerable to pass up.  A MAN in a gray overcoat slides out from between two buildings in front of her.  He is not coy about his intent.  He comes straight at her, all business. Lisa freezes in place.  She looks at her watch.  The man grabs her by the shoulder.  When she starts to scream, he claps his hand over her mouth, hard.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Her eyes look around frantically.  He starts to drag her backwards into the dark.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: You bite me, bitch, I'll pull your teeth out.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: leaps into view, and slams the man's head into a light post.  It takes a lot of slamming before lie loosens his grip on Lisa.  His legs at last collapse under him. Anderson scoops Lisa off the ground.  She hugs him hard. Then pulls back from him.  She gives him a look.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Cut it a little close there, honeybunch.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Rose got the street wrong.  She's getting weak.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . THE BOARDING HOUSE -- LATER Rose sits up in bed silently watching Lisa and Anderson together. Lisa needs to touch him.  She keeps a hand on his arm, brushes back a loose look of his hair.  Rose is mesmerized by her actions.  She drinks in everything, every bit of life. Anderson and Lisa are deep in conversation.  They speak to each other as if Rose were hardly present in the room. Anderson is trying to process everything Lisa has told him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They are silent for a long time.  Rose watches them work it through.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Anderson is shaking.  Lisa wraps her arms around him.  His voice is a stunned whisper.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Anderson and Lisa turn and look at Rose.  She lies curled on the bed, her face to the wall.
